definition.name: NXsensor
definition.doc: This class describes a sensor used to monitor an external condition - the condition itself is described in NXenvironment

field.name: short_name
field.doc: Short name of sensor used e.g. on monitor display program

group.name: geometry
group.doc: Defines the axes for logged vector quantities if they are not the global instrument axes

field.name: type
field.doc:
The type of hardware used for the measurement. Examples (suggestions but not restrictions):
:Temperature: J | K | T | E | R | S | Pt100 | Rh/Fe :pH: Hg/Hg2Cl2 | Ag/AgCl | ISFET :Ion selective electrode: specify species; e.g. Ca2+ :Magnetic field: Hall :Surface pressure: wilhelmy plate

field.name: run_control
field.doc: Is data collection controlled or synchronised to this quantity: 1=no, 0=to "value", 1=to "value_deriv1", etc.

field.name: high_trip_value
field.doc: Upper control bound of sensor reading if using run_control

field.name: low_trip_value
field.doc: Lower control bound of sensor reading if using run_control

field.name: value
field.doc: nominal setpoint or average value - need [n] as may be a vector

field.name: value_deriv1
field.doc: Nominal/average first derivative of value e.g. strain rate - same dimensions as "value" (may be a vector)

field.name: value_deriv2
field.doc: Nominal/average second derivative of value - same dimensions as "value" (may be a vector)

group.name: value_deriv1_log
group.doc: Time history of first derivative of sensor readings

group.name: value_deriv2_log
group.doc: Time history of second derivative of sensor readings

group.name: external_field_full
group.doc: For complex external fields not satisfied by External_field_brief
